title: What was the first example of 'fan fiction' ever written? - Quora

response.answer_text: The first one that I know of, chronologically, would the The Aeneid. Written by Virgil, it picks up from the end of the famous Greek epic The Iliad and tells a story of another journey happening simultaneously with The Odyssey—but from the point of view of the war’s losers, the Trojans. Virgil created a number of OCs who turn out to be early ancestors of the Romans.
A good candidate might be SHAMELA, by Henry Fielding (author of TOM JONES). It’s a parodic retelling of Richardson’s PAMELA, so maybe it should be called anti-fan-fiction.
